devdoc.details: This contract manage PACT dAPP with main functionallits to create a contract between client to hire a worker to perform a task,      and allows the worker to sign the contract, start working, request client validation,      and for the client to validate the work and allow payment. The client can also cancel the      contract before the worker signs, and the worker can cancel the contract at any time.      If a dispute arises, the client or worker can open a dispute and a jury will be selected randomly      to resolve the dispute. They resolve the dispute by voting on whether the worker or client is      in the right. The jury can also vote to split the payment between the client and worker.This contract is working in progress and is not yet complete. todo: add a function to limit time for the jury to vote and if not call a new jury to vote todo: add a function to limit time for the client to reveal the vote and if not call a new jury to vote todo: add payment splitter to split the payment between the client and worker todo: improve randomness of jury selection to pay less gas

addClient().details: Add a new client to the clients mapping.

addJury().details: Add a new jury to the juryPool mapping.

addWorker().details: Add a new worker to the workers mapping.

cancelContractByClient(uint256).details: Allows the client to cancel the contract only if the worker didn't sign the contract yet.

params._contractId: The ID of the contract to be canceled

cancelContractByWorker(uint256).details: Allows the worker to cancel the contract

params._contractId: The ID of the contract to be canceled

constructor.details: Constructor to set the protocol and jury fees, as well as the jury length

params._juryLength: The length of time for the jury vote

createContract(uint256,uint256,bytes32).details: Function to create a new contract sent by a client

params._hash: the hash of the job bytes32 of title and description

params._disputeId: The ID of the dispute to get jury members for

returns._0: An array of addresses representing the jury members for the dispute

params._disputeId: The ID of the dispute to check
params._juryAddress: The address of the jury member to check for a vote

returns._0: true if the jury member has voted on the dispute, false otherwise

isClient().details: Function to check if the caller is registered as a client

returns._0: a boolean value indicating if the sender is a client (true) or not (false)

isJury(address).details: Function to check if the caller is registered as a jury

returns._0: a boolean value indicating if the sender is a jury (true) or not (false)

params._disputeId: The ID of the dispute to check
params._juryAddress: The address to check for membership in the dispute's jury

returns._0: true if the address is a member of the dispute's jury, false otherwise

isWorker().details: Function to check if the caller is registered as a worker

returns._0: a boolean value indicating if the sender is a worker (true) or not (false)

openDispute(uint256).details: Allows the client or worker to open a dispute

params._contractId: The ID of the contract to open a dispute

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

pullPayment(uint256).details: This function allows the client or worker to pull payment and split if jury dispute with jury Members and protocol share and the worker if he won the dispute.

removeClient().details: Function to remove a client from the clients mapping

removeJury().details: Function to remove a jury from the juryPool mapping

removeWorker().details: Function to remove a worker from the workers mapping

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions anymore. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby removing any functionality that is only available to the owner.

requestClientValidation(uint256).details: Allows the worker to request client validation to the client when the work is done

params._contractId: The ID of the contract to be reviewed by the client.

revealState(uint256).details: This function reveals the state of a dispute and determines whether the client or the worker won the dispute.

selectJuryMember(uint256).details: Allows the client or worker to open a dispute

params._contractId: The ID of the contract in dispute

setIsFinishedAndAllowPayment(uint256).details: Allows the client to validate the work done by the worker

params._contractId: The ID of the contract to be validated

setJuryFee(uint8).details: Function to set the jury fee percentage.

params._juryFee: The new jury fee percentage to be set.

setJuryLength(uint8).details: Function to set the length of time in days that a jury member can vote in a dispute.

params._juryLength: The new length of time in days to be set.

setProtocolFee(uint8).details: Function to set the protocol fee percentage.

params._protocolFee: The new protocol fee percentage to be set.

signContract(uint256).details: Allows the worker to take the job

params._contractId: The ID of the contract to be signed

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

vote(uint256,bool).details: This function for the jury to vote for the dispute between the client and the worker

params._vote: The vote of the jury member.

devdoc.title: freelanceContract

addClient().notice: Caller should be a non-zero addresses and the client doesn't already exist.

addJury().notice: Caller should be a non-zero addresses Increments the juryCounter, and adds the sender to the juryPool with the new jury ID.

addWorker().notice: Caller should be a non-zero addresses and the worker doesn't already exist.

getJuryMembers(uint256).notice: Returns the addresses of all the jury members for a given dispute

hasVoted(uint256,address).notice: Checks if a given jury member has voted on a specific dispute

isJuryInDispute(uint256,address).notice: Checks if a given address is a member of the jury for a particular dispute

removeClient().notice: Caller should be a non-zero addresses and the client already exists.If the client does not exist, the function will revert.

removeWorker().notice: If the worker to be removed does not exist in the workers mapping, the function will revert.

selectJuryMember(uint256).notice: Selects a jury member for a given contract's dispute

setJuryFee(uint8).notice: Only the owner of the contract can call this function.

setJuryLength(uint8).notice: Only the owner of the contract can call this function.

setProtocolFee(uint8).notice: Only the owner of the contract can call this function.

userdoc.notice: This contract is not audited and should not be used in production.
